title: Overview
content: As an Ironman, you cannot buy food from the Grand Exchange, so Cooking XP is a natural byproduct of Fishing training. Cook your caught fish as you go rather than hoarding them raw.
Focus on levelling Fishing alongside Cooking. The Cooking cape, once earned, eliminates burn chance for most fish. Portable ranges created by other players can still be used by Ironmen.

title: Levels 1-30: Early Fish
content: Begin with whatever you can catch or obtain early in your Ironman journey.
- Levels 1-15: Shrimp and anchovies from net fishing spots (30–34 XP)
- Levels 15-30: Trout (70 XP) and Salmon (90 XP) from fly fishing at Barbarian Village or Lumbridge
Use the fire at the Barbarian Village or any range nearby to cook your catches immediately.

title: Levels 30-68: Lobsters and Swordfish
content: Fish at members' fishing spots for mid-level supplies. Catherby and the Fishing Guild are popular Ironman fishing locations.
- Levels 30-50: Tuna (100 XP) and Lobsters (120 XP) from harpoon fishing spots
- Levels 50-68: Swordfish (140 XP) for slightly higher XP per cook
- Levels 62-68: Monkfish (150 XP) at Piscatoris Fishing Colony — requires Swan Song quest
Stockpile cooked food for combat training, as Ironmen rely entirely on self-sourced supplies.

title: Levels 68-90: Monkfish and Sharks
content: From 68 onwards, focus on sharks for their combination of high Cooking XP and usefulness in combat.
- Levels 68-76: Monkfish (150 XP) — caught at Piscatoris Fishing Colony
- Levels 76-90: Sharks (210 XP) — caught at Fishing Guild or Catherby harpoon spots (requires 76 Fishing)
Cook at the Fishing Guild range, which is close to the bank, for efficient turnaround.

title: Levels 90-99/120: Rocktails and Sailfish
content: End-game Ironman Cooking is largely a byproduct of levelling Fishing to 86+ for Rocktails and 97+ for Sailfish.
- Levels 86-97 Fishing: Rocktails (225 XP each) from Living Rock Caverns
- Levels 97+ Fishing: Sailfish (270 XP each) — highest Cooking XP available
The Cooking cape eliminates burn chance once worn at level 99. Rocktails and Sailfish require 93 and 99 Cooking to stop burning without gauntlets.

title: Quest XP Rewards
content: Several quests grant Cooking XP and are worth doing early to skip tedious low-level training:
- Cooks' Assistant: 300 Cooking XP — one of the first quests available
- Ratcatchers: 2,500 Cooking XP
- Evil Dave's Big Day Out: 5,000 Cooking XP
- Recipe for Disaster subquests: Various XP rewards across multiple subquests
Complete available cooking quests as early as possible to jump past the slowest levels.
